Consider a proposal for using a capacitor as a digital memory:
Suppose that STORE is high so the switch is on. Also assume that the switch has \(R_{ON} = $RON\Omega\) and the capacitor has a capacitance of \($CGSf\)fF.
How much time, in picoseconds, does it take to charge the capacitor from \(V_{OL}=$VOL\)V to \(V_{OH}=$VOH\)V, with \(d_{IN} = $VS\)V?
Now, suppose that \(d_{IN} = $VOL\)V. How much time, in picoseconds, does it take to discharge the capacitor from \(V_{OH}=$VOH\)V to \(V_{IL}=$VIL\)V?
